attributes.title: Coca Cola TNC Map - JSIS 123
attributes.description:
Coca Cola has transformed into a transnational corporation and has globalized to over 200 countries in 2013 since its small beginnings in Atlanta, Georgia, USA in 1887.

Coca Cola owns many different brands and products including Dasani water, Odwalla, Sprite, Fanta, among others.

This map will trace the main production and distribution chains of Coca Cola in the Americas, Europe, Africa, Asia, and Oceania.

Since there are so many components and types of coke products, this map will only trace the two main industries of coca cola:

1. Bottling facilities & partners across the globe

2. Regional distribution centers

It is important to note that the key resources for coke products range from plastics, to aluminum, to water, this makes it difficult to trace every component involved in producing the coke product and thus only the bottling and distribution will be shown on this map.
This is the principal bottling location of Coca-Cola SABCO in Nepal. This specific location distributes to local vendors and customers across the country.
attributes.title: Coca Cola SABCO local bottler

attributes.description: This is the principal bottling location of Coca-Cola SABCO in Kenya. This specific location distributes to local vendors and customers across the country.
attributes.title: Coca Cola SABCO local bottler

attributes.description: This is the principal bottling location of Coca-Cola SABCO in Sri Lanka. This specific location distributes to local vendors and customers across the country.
attributes.title: Coca Cola SABCO partner & local bottler

attributes.description:
Coca Cola SABCO is a manufacturer and bottler based in South Africa. This company has majority ownership over smaller bottlers in South Africa, Ethiopia, Kenya, Mozambique, Namibia, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Tanzania, and Uganda. 

For Example: "Coca-Cola Fortune (CCF) is one of four licensed Coca-Cola bottlers in South Africa. It was born out of a significant 2002 merger between the South African operation of Coca-Cola Sabco and Fortune Holdings (East London and Mpumalanga) in 2002. The company is non-listed and operates from Port Elizabeth.

Coca-Cola Fortune has five manufacturing sites, situated in Port Elizabeth, Bloemfontein, Polokwane, Nelspruit and Port Shepstone. It has approximately 3,000 employees"

http://www.cocacolasabco.com/Territory.aspx/Show
attributes.title: Coca-Cola SABCO

attributes.description: This is among one of the many receiving locations of Coca Cola Amatil. Product is distributed from Sydney, Australia and is stored in this receiving location. The product is further distributed to local retailers and vendors across the country.

attributes.description: This company is the primary bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's soft drinks across Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, Fiji, and Indonesia.
attributes.title: Coca-Cola Amatil

attributes.description: This is among one of the many bottling and manufacturing locations of Coca Cola FEMSA. The product is further distributed to smaller receiving locations and vendors across the country.

attributes.description: This is among one of the many receiving locations of Coca-Cola Hellenic. This specific location distributes to customers across Ireland.
attributes.title: Coca Cola Hellenic Receiving Location

attributes.description:
"Coca-Cola Hellenic serves 579 million people in 28 countries. We are one of the largest bottlers and vendors of The Coca-Cola Company’s products in the world, and the largest based in Europe.  Coca-Cola Hellenic was formed in 2000 as a result of the merger of the Athens-based Hellenic Bottling Company and the London-based Coca-Cola Beverages."

http://www.coca-colahellenic.com/aboutus/
attributes.title: Coca-Cola Hellenic

attributes.description:
"Sacramento Coca-Cola Bottling Co., Inc. is the exclusive manufacturer and distributor of Coca-Cola products in all or part of the 8 California Counties of Sacramento, Yolo, Solano, Placer, El Dorado, Amador, Stanislaus and Tuolumne."

http://www.saccoke.com/
attributes.title: Sacramento Coca-Cola Bottling Co., Inc.
Coca-Cola FEMSA de Buenos Aires, S.A.

attributes.description:
"Coca-Cola FEMSA, S.A. de C.V. ("KOF") operates in 10 countries:
The Valley of Mexico: Covering the metropolitan area of Mexico City and a large part of the adjacent State of Mexico.
Southeast Mexico: Covering the states of Tabasco and Chiapas, and part of the states of Oaxaca and Veracruz.
Central America: Covering countries as Guatemala, Nicaragua, Costa Rica and Panama.
South America Covering countries as Venezuela, Colombia, Brasil and Argentina
Southeastern Asia Covering the country of Philippines"

http://www.femsa.com/en/business/coca_cola_femsa/
attributes.title: Coca Cola FEMSA

attributes.description: This is the largest Coca Cola distributor and bottler in Canada. Where products are assembled, manufactured and distributed from this location to local vendors including retail chains.
attributes.address: 42 Overlea Boulevard, Toronto, ON M4H 1B8, Canada
attributes.title: Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada, Ltd.

attributes.description:
This bottling division of Coca-Cola operates in 11 states, primarily in the Southeast.  It operates in 5 manufacturing facilities across the region and owns more than 45 sales locations.

http://www.cokeconsolidated.com/locations.html
attributes.title: Coca Cola Bottling Co. Consolidated

attributes.description:
"In 2010 CCE completed a significant transaction with The Coca-Cola Company, which acquired all of CCE’s North American territory. CCE is one of the largest Coca-Cola bottlers in the world, and handles approximately 8% of the Coca-Cola system's global volume. We serve the countries of Belgium, France, Great Britain, Luxembourg, Monaco, the Netherlands, Norway, and Sweden."

http://www.cokecce.com/about-cce/our-story
attributes.title: Coca Cola Enterprises Inc.
Coca Cola Enterprises Inc. to Coca Cola Bottling Co. Consolidated

attributes.description:
"Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada, Ltd. produces, markets, sells, and distributes sparkling and still beverages. Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada, Ltd. was formerly known as Coca-Cola Bottling Company. The company is based in Toronto, Canada. Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada, Ltd. operates as a subsidiary of Coca-Cola Refreshments USA, Inc."

http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=4210415
attributes.title: Coca Cola Enterprises Inc. to Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada, Ltd.
Coca Cola FEMSA to Coca-Cola FEMSA de Buenos Aires, S.A.
attributes.description:
In Argentina, Coca Cola FEMSA purchased the Argentinian bottler as a variable capital corporation in October 1991. "Between 1994 and 1997, we acquired the Federal Capital territory, Buenos Aires, through the purchase of 100% of Coca-Cola FEMSA de Buenos Aires, S.A. de C.V. from a subsidiary of The Coca-Cola Company. In February 1996, we expanded our operations in Argentina to include the areas of San Isidro and Pilar, with the purchase of San Isidro Refrescos, S.A. (SIRSA)."

http://www.femsa.com/en/business/coca_cola_femsa/argentina.htm
